wikipedia_page.main: Dick Finnigan  ((1904-05-16)16 May 1904 – ) was a Welsh international footballer goalkeeper. He was part of the Wales national football team, playing 1 match on 1 February 1930 against Ireland. At club level, he played for Manchester City in 1926, playing eight matches and also played for Wrexham.

response: During the two years between November 1929 and October 1931, Wales called upon several keepers, including Cardiff City's Len Evans and Wrexham's Dick Finnigan, who was called up for the match against Ireland in February 1930 because Manchester City refused to release Gray. (The Irish won this match 7–0, with six goals from Joe Bambrick.)
